intro: Vaccinium hirtum var. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth blueberry, is a low-growing shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its glabrous (smooth) stems and leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which develop into edible berries. These berries are usually dark blue to black when mature and are rich in antioxidants and nutrients. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or heathland environments.
